maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Azure NetApp Files (ANF) volume.
The New-AzNetAppFilesVolume cmdlet creates an ANF volume.
The name of the ANF account
Specifies whether the volume is enabled for Azure VMware Solution (AVS) datastore purpose (Enabled, Disabled)
A hashtable array which represents the backup object
Backup ID. UUID v4 or resource identifier used to identify the Backup
Pool Resource Id used in case of creating a volume through volume group.
Specifies whether Cool Access(tiering) is enabled for the volume (default false).

CoolAccessRetrievalPolicy determines the data retrieval behavior from the cool tier to standard storage based on the read pattern for cool access enabled volumes. The possible values for this field are: Default - Data will be pulled from cool tier to standard storage on random reads. This policy is the default. OnRead - All client-driven data read is pulled from cool tier to standard storage on both sequential and random reads. Never - No client-driven data is pulled from cool tier to standard storage.
Specifies the number of days after which data that is not accessed by clients will be tiered (minimum 7, maximum 63).
A unique file path for the volume
Default group quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Default user quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies.
If enabled (true) the snapshot the volume was created from will be automatically deleted after the volume create operation has finished. Defaults to false
Flag indicating whether subvolume operations are enabled on the volume (Enabled, Disabled)
Source of key used to encrypt data in volume. Applicable if NetApp account has encryption.keySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'. Possible values are: 'Microsoft.NetApp, Microsoft.KeyVault'
A hashtable array which represents the export policy
Specifies if default quota is enabled for the volume
Specifies whether volume is a Large Volume or Regular Volume. Defaults to false
Describe if a volume is Kerberos Enabled
The resource ID of private endpoint for KeyVault. It must reside in the same VNET as the volume. Only applicable if encryptionKeySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'
Specifies whether LDAP is enabled or not for a given NFS volume.

command:example.maml:title: --------------- Example 1: Create an ANF volume ---------------
command:example.dev:code:
New-AzNetAppFilesVolume -ResourceGroupName "MyRG" -AccountName "MyAnfAccount" -PoolName "MyAnfPool" -Name "MyAnfVolume" -Location "westus2" -CreationToken "MyAnfVolume" -UsageThreshold 1099511627776 -ServiceLevel "Premium" -SubnetId "/subscriptions/subsId/resourceGroups/MyRG/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/MyVnetName/subnets/MySubNetName"
Location : westus2 Id : /subscriptions/subsId/resourceGroups/MyRG/providers/Microsoft.NetApp/netAppAccounts/MyAnfAccount/capacityPools/MyAnfPool/volumes/MyAnfVolume Name : MyAnfAccount/MyAnfPool/MyAnfVolume Type : Microsoft.NetApp/netAppAccounts/capacityPools/volumes Tags : FileSystemId : 3e2773a7-2a72-d003-0637-1a8b1fa3eaaf CreationToken : MyAnfVolume ServiceLevel : Premium UsageThreshold : 1099511627776 ProvisioningState : Succeeded SubnetId : /subscriptions/f557b96d-2308-4a18-aae1-b8f7e7e70cc7/resourceGroups/MyRG/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/MyVnetName/subnets/default

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command creates the new ANF volume "MyAnfVolume" within the pool "MyAnfPool".

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Azure NetApp Files (ANF) VolumeGroup along with requisite volumes. Creating volume group will create all the volumes specified in request body implicitly. Once volumes are created using volume group, those will be treated as regular volumes thereafter.
The New-AzNetAppFilesVolumeGroup cmdlet creates an ANF VolumeGroup.
The name of the ANF account
Application specific identifier, default SAP System ID SH1
Application Type, default SAP-HANA
A hashtable array which represents the protocol types for Data Backup/Log Backup volumes default NFSv4.1, for other volume types nfsv4.1 will be used.
Capacity overhead %, Additional quota reserved for snapshots during best-practice sizing of data volume, default 50
Specify throughput in MiB/s. If ommited DataBackupPerformance will be autocalculated or specify an integer value representing throughput.
Specify capacity (in GiB). If ommited DataSize will be autocalculated or specify an integer value representing size.
Specify throughput in MiB/s. If ommited DataPerformance will be autocalculated or specify and integer value representing throughput.
Specify capacity (in GiB). If ommited DataSize will be autocalculated or specify an integer value representing size.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Create volume groups for DR, using ANF Cross Region Replication, scenario allows volumes to be replicated between different regions using SnapMirror
A hashtable array which represents the export policy, which should be common to all volumes.
Application specific placement rules for the volume group
Group Description, example Primary for SH1-{HostId} (default)
HANA System Replication (HSR): Replication between the same SID instance on hosts in the same region, or differerent regions. This could be Scale-Up or Scale-Out configurations.
Number of SAP HANA hosts. Total Number of SAP HANA hosts for single or multiplehost scenarios. Defaults to 50 for single-host setups. Currently at max 3 nodes can be configured.
The location of the resource
Specify throughput in MiB/s. If ommited LogBackupPerformance will be autocalculated or specify an integer value representing throughput.
Specify capacity (in GiB). If ommited DataSize will be autocalculated or specify an integer value representing size.

Specify capacity (in GiB). If ommited LogSize will be autocalculated or specify an integer value representing size.

The name of the ANF VolumeGroup, example SAP-HANA-SH00001. Defaults to SAP-HANA-{HostId}, where the {HostId} pattern in the name will be replaced by a 5 digit host ID that begins at 1 for the Single-host and counts up for the subsequent Multiple-host, host
SAP node memory (GiB), Memory on SAP compute host
Default capacity pool for volumes, use a manual QoS type capacity pool
All volume names will be prefixed with the given text. The default values for prefix text depends on system role. For PRIMARY it will be empty and HA it will be "HA - "
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Default proximity placement group, for data, log, and if present the shared volume, in all volume groups. Specifies that the data, log, and shared volumes are to be created close to the VMs

Starting SAP HANA Host ID. Host ID 1 indicates Master Host. Shared, Data Backup and Log Backup volumes are only provisioned for Master Host i.e. HostID == 1.1
Default delegated subnet, for all volume groups
The role of the system, Primary SAP system, HANA System Replication(HSR) or DataRecovery destination for ANF Cross-region replication (CRR)

Default virtual network, for all volume groups

maml:description.maml:para: Updates an Azure NetApp Files (ANF) volume according to the optional modifiers provided.

A hashtable array which represents the backup object
Specifies whether Cool Access(tiering) is enabled for the volume (default false).

CoolAccessRetrievalPolicy determines the data retrieval behavior from the cool tier to standard storage based on the read pattern for cool access enabled volumes. The possible values for this field are: Default - Data will be pulled from cool tier to standard storage on random reads. This policy is the default. OnRead - All client-driven data read is pulled from cool tier to standard storage on both sequential and random reads. Never - No client-driven data is pulled from cool tier to standard storage.
Specifies the number of days after which data that is not accessed by clients will be tiered (minimum 7, maximum 63).
Default group quota for volume in KiBs. If isDefaultQuotaEnabled is set, the minimum value of 4 KiBs applies.

command:example.maml:title: --------------- Example 1: Update an ANF volume ---------------
command:example.dev:code:
Update-AzNetAppFilesVolume -ResourceGroupName "MyRG" -Location "westus2" -AccountName "MyAnfAccount" -PoolName "MyAnfPool" -Name "MyAnfVolume" -UsageThreshold Size
Location : westus2 Id : /subscriptions/subsId/resourceGroups/MyRG/providers/Microsoft.NetApp/netAppAccounts/MyAnfAccount/capacityPools/MyAnfPool/volumes/MyAnfVolume Name : MyAnfAccount/MyAnfPool/MyAnfVolume Type : Microsoft.NetApp/netAppAccounts/capacityPools/volumes Tags : FileSystemId : 3e2773a7-2a72-d003-0637-1a8b1fa3eaaf CreationToken : MyAnfVolume ServiceLevel : Premium UsageThreshold : 2199023255552 ProvisioningState : Succeeded SubnetId : /subscriptions/subsId/resourceGroups/MyRG/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/MyRG-vnet/subnets/default

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command updates the ANF volume "MyAnfVolume" with the new UsageThreshold size.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates an Azure NetApp Files (ANF) volume quota rule according to the optional modifiers provided.
The Update-AzNetAppFilesVolumeQuotaRule cmdlet updates an ANF volume quota rule.
The name of the ANF account
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The name of the ANF Subvolume
The name of the ANF pool

The resource group of the ANF account
A hashtable which represents resource tags
